prompt:
---
name: Extract Elements of Text
description: Extract specific elements of text from a given text
source: OpenAI documentation
url: https://help.openai.com/en/articles/6654000-best-practices-for-prompt-engineering-with-the-openai-api
inputs: 
   text:
      type: string
---
system:
Extract the important entities mentioned in the text below. First extract all company names, then extract all people names, then extract specific topics which fit the content and finally extract general overarching themes

Desired format:
Company names: <comma_separated_list_of_company_names>
People names: -||-
Specific topics: -||-
General themes: -||-
user:
Text: {{ text }}
inputSpec:
The input is a string of text provided under the key 'text'.
The text may include mentions of company names, people names, specific topics, and general themes.
rules: The output must consist of exactly four separate lines.
Each line must begin with a category label followed by a colon.
The category labels must be "Company names", "People names", "Specific topics", and "General themes", in that exact order.
Each category label must be written exactly as specified, including capitalization and spelling.
After the colon on each line, the assistant must provide a comma-separated list of extracted entities corresponding to that category.
The entities in each list must be separated by commas and must not include any additional punctuation.
If there are no entities to list in a category, the assistant must still include the category label followed by a colon and leave it empty.
For "Company names", the assistant must extract all company names mentioned in the text, where a company name is the official name of a legally recognized business organization.
For "People names", the assistant must extract all personal names mentioned in the text, where a people name is the full name or commonly recognized name of an individual person.
For "Specific topics", the assistant must extract all specific topics discussed in the text, where a specific topic is a particular subject, concept, or issue that is directly addressed.

For "General themes", the assistant must extract all general overarching themes present in the text, where a general theme is a broad and abstract idea or subject that captures the main essence or message of the text.
The assistant must only extract entities that are explicitly mentioned or clearly implied in the text.
The assistant must not add any extra text, explanations, or formatting beyond what is specified in the desired format.
The assistant must not include numbering, bullet points, or any other formatting marks besides those specified.
The assistant must ensure that the output exactly matches the desired format provided, with precise adherence to structure and content requirements.
inverseRules: The output must not consist of exactly four separate lines.
Lines may not begin with a category label followed by a colon.
The category labels may differ from "Company names", "People names", "Specific topics", and "General themes", or may be in any order.
Each category label can be written differently than specified, including changes in capitalization and spelling.
After the colon on each line, the assistant may avoid providing a comma-separated list of extracted entities corresponding to that category.
The entities in each list may include additional punctuation or be separated by other delimiters than commas.
If there are no entities to list in a category, the assistant may omit the category label or add content after the colon.
For "Company names", the assistant may choose not to extract company names or may include entities that are not official business organizations.
For "People names", the assistant may choose not to extract personal names or may include names that are not of individual persons.
For "Specific topics", the assistant may choose not to extract specific topics discussed in the text.
For "General themes", the assistant may choose not to extract general overarching themes or may include specific details instead.
The assistant may extract entities not explicitly mentioned or implied in the text.
The assistant may add extra text, explanations, or formatting beyond what is specified in the desired format.
The assistant may include numbering, bullet points, or other formatting marks besides those specified.
The assistant does not need to ensure that the output exactly matches the desired format provided, and may deviate from structure and content requirements.
